title: These two online shopping platforms are rallying ahead of Amazon's earnings

title: Tech Titans' AI Strategy

title: Amazon Updates Code to Keep Out Google AI Shopping Tools
text: Amazon is reportedly taking steps to block other companies' artificial intelligence shopping tools from its website. The eCommerce giant updated the code on its site to include language that keeps out new AI agents from Google, The Information reported Wednesday (July 30).

title: Amazon Q2 earnings preview: AI bets, cloud growth, and tariff changes in the spotlight
text: Amazon's infrastructure investments and cloud business will go under the microscope Thursday when the company reports second-quarter financial results — with Wall Street looking for signs that the tech giant's big bet on artificial intelligence is translating into growth.

title: Report: Amazon to pay at least $20M a year in AI content deal with New York Times
text: Amazon's deal to license some content from The New York Times for use on the tech giant's artificial intelligence platforms will cost at least $20 million annually, The Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday.

title: Amazon to Pay NYT Up to $25 Million for AI Licensing
text: Amazon's artificial intelligence licensing deal with The New York Times reportedly carries an eight-figure annual price tag. The tech giant will pay the news company between $20 million and $25 million per year for content to train its AI models, The Wall Street Journal (WSJ) reported Wednesday (July 30), citing unnamed sources.

title: Should You Sell AMZN Stock Ahead of Its Earnings?
text: Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) is scheduled to report its earnings on Thursday, July 31, 2025. For event-driven traders, understanding historical patterns around these announcements can provide a strategic edge.

title: Windfall Bio's Partnership with Amazon's Climate Pledge Fund and Whole Foods Market Highlighted in Annual Sustainability and Impact Reports
text: SAN MATEO, Calif., July 30, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- This month, Amazon and Whole Foods Market released their annual sustainability and impact reports, providing an in-depth look at their ongoing commitment and efforts to nourish people and the planet. In both reports, Windfall Bio was recognized for its nature-based solution harnessing mems to transform methane into high-value organic fertilizer. Mems are natural soil microbes that consume methane directly from a variety of gas streams. This approach enables customers from various industries to operate more efficiently and profitably, while also reducing their overall carbon footprint, as methane has over 86x greater warming potential compared to carbon dioxide over a 20-year window.

title: Amazon to Pay New York Times at Least $20 Million a Year in AI Deal
text: The multiyear deal lets Amazon use content from the Times's news and cooking sections and the Athletic.

title: Amazon's earnings are due. It needs to prove it isn't a ‘one-hit wonder'
text: Amazon's cloud-services business will be a key focus when the e-commerce giant reports earnings, with AWS revenue expected to grow 17%.

title: Amazon still the online retailer of choice as cloud business faces competition
text: Amazon will seek to reassure investors on Thursday that its cloud business, a critical driver of profits, is growing at a fast enough clip to offset any pullback in consumer spending that could throttle its retail operations.
